column4: what is vmware? Can I use it to install another OS on top of Ubuntu?
it's a virtualisation system - it creates a virtual PC you can install another OS into
and is it free?
nope
they do a free "player", but you can't install an OS with it, just run an existing image
and what about the free "server"?
no idea, not touched it, but it's probably way overkill for what you want
oh, thanks. The one I want is "VMWare Workstation" then?
I reckon so, yeah
thanks. Do you know of any free alternatives?
consult vmware's install docs, then install windows inside it. that's kinda outside the scope of this channel really
I understand that, I wanted to know if someone has a link to the docs, actually. (or something like https://wiki.ubuntu.com/WindowsXPUnderQemuHowTo )
break things mostly ;)
the idea is that you can install software manually, but checkinstall will keep track of it
oh, so is it recommended to use it or not?
personally I don't like it, but other people do, so I guess it's a personal preference thing. I generally try to avoid installing any software manually if possible anyway
Does it keep track of what arbitrary scripts do?!
for any given piece of software it may work perfectly, partially or not at all. So, it's not a helpful answer, but I would say.... maybe
/var/log/auth.log
Hmm, I see lots of people have been trying! What should I do about it?!
that's up to you - personally I just make sure that my passwords are strong and the system is up-to-date, but you can move it to another port or require ssh keys if you like
ok, so it's not a problem? The same user has been trying lots of random usernames :)
